title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
As shown on the graph, P2 and Q2 were the price and quantity of oil before trade in the US market.

1 point - Identifying P2

1 point - Identifying Q2
descriptions:
Student receives 0/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P2

1 point - Identifying Q2

Student receives 1/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P2

1 point - Identifying Q2

Student receives 2/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P2

1 point - Identifying Q2

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The amount of oil imported into the US market after trade would be equal to Q3-Q1. US production drops to Q1 but quantity demanded rises to Q3.

1 point: (Imports) Identifying (Q3 - Q1) or (H-J)
descriptions:
Student receives 0/1 point(s)

1 point: (Imports) Identifying (Q3 - Q1) or (H-J)

Student receives 1/1 point(s)

1 point: (Imports) Identifying (Q3 - Q1) or (H-J)

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The triangle P2KG represents consumer surplus before trade, while triangle PWKH represents consumer surplus after trade.

1 point - Identifying P2KG (before)

1 point - Identifying PWKH (after)
descriptions:
Student receives 0/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P2KG (before)

1 point - Identifying PWKH (after)

Student receives 1/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P2KG (before)

1 point - Identifying PWKH (after)

Student receives 2/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P2KG (before)

1 point - Identifying PWKH (after)

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
The triangle P1P2G represents producer surplus before trade, while triangle P1PWJ represents producer surplus after trade.

1 point - Identifying P1P2G (before)

1 point - Identifying P1PWJ (after)
descriptions:
Student receives 0/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P1P2G (before)

1 point - Identifying P1PWJ (after)

Student receives 1/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P1P2G (before)

1 point - Identifying P1PWJ (after)

Student receives 2/2 point(s)

1 point - Identifying P1P2G (before)

1 point - Identifying P1PWJ (after)

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
The triangle JGH shows the net gain in total surplus from trade.


1 point: (Net gain in surplus) Identifying JGH
descriptions:
Student receives 0/1 point(s)


1 point: (Net gain in surplus) Identifying JGH

Student receives 1/1 point(s)


1 point: (Net gain in surplus) Identifying JGH
